revised_title: Thermal Conductivity of Toluene: A Proposed Data Standard
tldr: The authors present a detailed review and extension of the hot-wire method for measuring fluid thermal conductivity, focusing on the determination of the thermal conductivity of toluene as a proposed data standard. They discuss various approximations and sources of error in the method and provide design criteria to minimize experimental errors. The transient hot-wire method offers several advantages, including a small-volume, low-diameter cell, ease of construction, and immunity to distortion under extreme conditions.
